t: Then*p I turned and raised my eyes, and saw there a flying scroll.
And*p he said to me, “What do you see?” So*p I answered, “I see a flying scroll. Its length is*i twenty cubits and its width ten cubits.”

Then*p he said to me, “This is*i the curse that goes out over the face of the whole earth: ‘Every thief shall be expelled,’ according to*i this side of the*i scroll;*i and, ‘Every perjurer shall be expelled,’ according to*i that side of it.”

“I*pn will send out the*i curse,”*i says the Lord*s of hosts; “It*ld shall enter the house of the thief And*ld the house of the one who swears falsely by My name. It*ld shall remain in the midst of his house And*ld consume it, with its timber and stones.”
Vision of the Woman in a Basket
Then*p the angel who talked with me came out and said to me, “Lift your eyes now, and see what this is*i that goes forth.”
So*p I asked, “What is*i it?” And he said, “It is*i a basket that is going forth.” He*p also said, “This is*i their resemblance throughout the earth:
Here is*i a lead disc lifted up, and this is*i a woman sitting inside the basket”;
then he said, “This is*i Wickedness!” And he thrust her down into the basket, and threw the lead cover over its mouth.

Then I raised my eyes and looked, and there were*i two women, coming with the wind in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between earth and heaven.
So*p I said to the angel who talked with me, “Where are they carrying the basket?”
And*p he said to me, “To build a house for it in the land of Shinar; when it is ready, the*i basket*i will be set there on its base.”
